markscheme-components.a:
Explanation, e.g. there should be 4 dp in the answer or the answer should be smaller than 0.38 (or 0.26) or because 0.4 × 0.3 = 0.12

Clear sensible reason (not just giving the actual answer with no working or explanation)

Condone: multiplying two decimals means a smaller number oe
markscheme-components.b:
Explanation, e.g. the answer should be bigger than 1 because both 3/4 and 2/3 are bigger than 1/2 or the answer should be bigger than 3/4 but 5/7 is smaller than 3/4 oe

Exemplars for 1 mark:
• “you don’t add fractions by adding tops and bottoms”
• “you don’t add the denominators”
• “you have to find a common denominator first”
• “3/4 + 2/3 is obviously > 1”

16.markscheme-components:
Correct answer (264) with complete correct working, e.g. (3 + 1) × 6 × 11

Marks: 4

M3 for correct working but no final answer stated (3 + 1) × 6 × 11, or the working is poorly communicated but is clear, e.g. (3 + 1) × 6 × 11 = 264, or any number greater than 200 with complete correct working.

Or M2 for 264 with no (or incomplete) working, or for an acceptable number over 200 with poorly communicated working.

Or M1 for number greater than 200 with no, or incomplete, working, or for (3 × 6) × 11 [× 1] condoning an error in calculation, or for two trials leading to numbers below 200 (condone poor communication), or acceptable calculation with their answer minimum 200 but an error in evaluation.

Working correctly communicated in stages is acceptable for 4 marks, e.g. 3 + 1 = 4, 4 × 6 = 24, 24 × 11 = 264.

Full written explanation is also acceptable.

For 1 or 2 marks, “acceptable” implies a number (minimum 200) that can be made.
